intro: Gongronema wallichii, commonly known as the mountain nettle, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many stinging plants. The plant is characterized by its alternate, heart-shaped leaves with prominent veins. It produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters. Gongronema wallichii is often found in moist, shaded areas at higher elevations.
